Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼ ʔušudub ʔə ti pastəd tiʔiɬ səsc̕əbidup ʔə ti ʔaciɬtalbixʷ tiləb dxʷʔal ti suƛ'uyuqʷucuts əlgʷəʔ
English: As soon as the white people saw the cleared lands of the Indians, right to that area they pushed themselves.

Lushootseed: yawʼ haʔɬ kʷi ɬuscils dəxʷəscildxʷyid čəɬ ƛ'əsuqʼʷəlb čəɬ, tiʔiɬ ƛ'usc̕əbixʷ, stab.
English: It would be great to have our roasted food, the picked berries, (and other) things dished up properly.
top of fir tree
Thrush went on board, she was sopping wet.

Lushootseed: xʷəƛ'yid ʔə ti sc̕ədᶻx̌ čxʷa c̕ədᶻx̌abacəd.
English: Break off nettles to use on her and you nettle her body.
I'm (going to) nettle your body.

Lushootseed: ʔəsc̕əkʼbid čəd kʷi gʷədsʔux̌ʷ dxʷʔal kʷi lil swatixʷtəd
English: I'm eager to go to a distant land.
We were beaten.
We were guessed; that is why we were beaten (in the bone game).
I won.
Which side won?

Lushootseed: ƛ'ub čəxʷ ʔuc̕əlalikʷtubuɬ dxʷʔal gʷəɬ bəkʼʷ dᶻəkʼʷadəd čəɬ
English: It is well that you win us over from all our error.
the water was stagnant
You will be in the swamp.
He threw her there into the swamp.
That will always be yours.
You folks take care of it, always.
(Something) you (ate) went down the wrong 'pipe'.

Lushootseed: huy c̕əstəbəxʷ tiʔəʔ qəlubs, yəx̌i ʔəskʼʷil
English: Then he pecks his eye because he is peeking (out).

Lushootseed: ƛ'ub əwʼə čəd ʔuc̕əsyid ʔə tə sʔəɬəds, ʔukʷukʷs.
English: I had better peck at his food (the tallow) which he plays with.
Give me a pinch of it.
That one walking (this way) is sure good-looking.

Lushootseed: ʔucutcut tiʔiɬ suc̕əwʼqəb ʔə tsiʔəʔ kayʼkayʼ.
English: Steller's Jay talked in Sahaptin.
worn out

Lushootseed: tuc̕əxʷdxʷaxʷ tiʔəʔ sqʼaxʷ ʔal tiʔəʔ tədəxʷəsdukʷutəbs.
English: He wore the ice through where he had been hexed.

Lushootseed: dəxʷc̕ibs ʔə tiʔiɬ kʼayəyəʔ ʔə tiʔiɬ bəsx̌ʷ̌əs
English: So the dried salmon could be dipped in the grease.

Lushootseed: kʼayəyəʔ ti dəxʷc̕ibs ʔə tiʔiɬ bəsx̌ʷəs
English: So he could dip the dried salmon in the grease
what he uses to dip with

spread its wings

Lushootseed: ʔuʔəx̌id əwʼə sixʷ tiʔiɬ adəxʷuc̕ic̕əyikʷalusbid tsiʔiɬ tsiʔəʔ dsuxʷiʔxʷiʔ.
English: Why are you winking at my prey?
fresh animal (meat)

what I use to fry with
my frying pan

Go ahead and call him (your) younger brother.

Lushootseed: c̕uʔkʷs bit ʔi kʷi ɬixʷilc x̌ičičc
English: seventy-three cents

Lushootseed: ʔi gʷətuʔux̌ʷ čəɬ gʷəx̌ʷiʔəs ti ʔəshəlaʔb čəɬ x̌̌əɬx̌əɬ čɬa ʔəsc̕ud
English: Yes. We would have gone (but) we are much too sick, too much under the weather.

Lushootseed: ʔəsqʷalc tiʔəʔ bəsqʷ x̌ʷulʼ xʷəƛ'xʷəƛ'gʷasədəxʷ čxʷa kʼilc̕əd tiʔiɬ x̌əɬ ti šawʼ sc̕ukʼʷəbs dxʷʔal sdᶻuqʼʷils, čxʷa dᶻahakʼʷuʔəxʷ gʷəkʷəddxʷ ti haʔɬ biacs.
English: Crab are just boiled. You break them apart and pinch what is kind of like bone covering until it breaks apart, finally then you can get its good meat.
I sucked the water (through a straw).

Lushootseed: ʔabyitəb ʔə kʷədiʔ stab suc̕uqʷutəbs tulʼʔal tiʔəʔ cədiɬ stab sʔuladxʷ.
English: He was given something from a salmon to suck on.
He's sucking his finger.
I cannot see because it is too bright, i.e., the sun gets in my face.
I cannot see because it is too bright.
He can't see (his brother because) he is blinded by his bright and shining being.

Lushootseed: ʔəsqʷibicut tiʔəʔ cədiɬ; ʔučaʔkʷ ʔi stabəxʷ.
English: This one was all fixed up; he and some (others) came down to the shore.
Then they called out (to them) to come down to the shore.
And the animals came down.
all the (animals) came down

Lushootseed: ʔəsɬaɬlil lil čaʔkʷ ʔal tiʔəʔ hikʷ x̌ʷəlč.
English: She dwelled way out in the great sea.
The tide was way out.
go out from shore
I'm being forced out.

Lushootseed: ʔučaʔkʷdub tiʔiɬ sqigʷəc ʔə tiʔiɬ sqʷəbayʔ
English: The dog drove the deer to the water.
I managed to get it down to the shore.
And they had lots of food which was being brought down.

Lushootseed: tugʷadiləxʷ ʔal tiʔəʔ sčagʷəbs əlgʷəʔ tiʔəʔ wiwiwʼsu sʔuladxʷ
English: The little fish were leaping from down below.
There was a warrior who wanted to go to the coast.
I got too far out.
I'm angry with him, that's why I picked on him.
They ganged up on me. They got the best of me (because I was alone).
He has me cornered and is threatening me.
I was forced to do something undesirable because they overpowered me.
in front of the house
came down to the shore where I was
He must be fishing below us.

Lushootseed: ʔal tiʔiɬ čaʔkʷbids əlgʷəʔ təsgʷəƛ'əlad ʔə tiʔiɬ.
English: Below them (a little to the water side of them) he stopped.

Lushootseed: x̌əɬ ti dᶻəɬ tustuʔtələkʷ kʷədiʔ təsəshuy ʔə kʷədiʔ čaʔkʷbids, čaʔkʷbid ʔə tiʔəʔ ʔəsɬaɬlil.
English: There must have been a little river or something below there, below where they dwelled.
It spilled down to the sea.

and setting in the west (i.e., in the direction of Puget Sound)

He stacks it outside.

Lushootseed: ti ʔalʔal čəgʷayucid ʔə tə šəgʷɬ
English: The house is on the lower side of the road.

Lushootseed: ʔučaʔkʷčagʷələqid tə sʔəɬəd ʔə tə č'ač'as.
English: By the head (food) of the child comes down to shore.

Lushootseed: tukʷədatəb ʔə ti tudqəsiʔ ʔə kʷi hikʷ č'ƛ'aʔ čaʔčaʔkʷ.
English: My uncle used to get this (near) big rocks a little out from shore.
It is easy to fold.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼ kʷaʔ ƛ'uʔəxʷčabustəb tiʔəʔ sɬuay gʷəl ʔistəʔ ʔəskʷaltub liɬʔal tiʔəʔ, tiʔəʔ ƛ'udaʔatəb cəlakʷacəd ʔə tiʔəʔ č'ač'as.
English: They had just one added to another of the cedar bark and they had it woven along here this that is called (gloss unknown) for the child.

Lushootseed: ʔa ʔəsčabčabusəb liɬšəq ʔə ti ʔalʔal ʔə tiʔiɬ st'əqxʷ.
English: There (Snake) is coiled around himself on top of Beaver's house.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼ ʔəsčalatəb ʔə tiʔiɬ qʷuʔ ʔal tə sʔəƛ's higʷiləs.

Lushootseed: ləsčaɬadub tiʔəʔ sbiaw ʔə tsi ʔiɬt'isu.

Lushootseed: ƛ'uləkʼʷtəb kʼʷəɬ ʔə tiʔiɬ čaydi tiʔiɬ kʼadayuʔ. ƛ'sušəɬs əlgʷəʔ sɬuʔb

Lushootseed: ləčayɬəxʷ kʷi sʔux̌ʷs ʔal tiʔiɬ ʔuqʼʷuʔqʼʷuʔ.

packing something on back

Lushootseed: ʔučəbaʔ tsiʔiɬ xʷiʔ ləhaʔɬ sƛ'alqəb ʔə tiʔiɬ
English: That no-good she monster packed them off.

Lushootseed: ʔučəbaʔtəb ʔə ti dbad tə sqigʷəcaɬc̕iʔ dxʷʔal ʔalʔal

English: And, lifting these raccoons up and down (in order to supernaturally lighten them), her husband put them on her back.

Make him pack it.

Lushootseed: x̌əɬ ti ʔa tiʔiɬ ƛ'ux̌ičəc ƛ'əsəstabs ʔal tiʔiɬ č'əptəlax̌ads.

English: and I am very tired as I am coming, coming home

Lushootseed: ɬudxʷxʷəƛ'alšəd čəd ʔə kʷi sqʷuʔqʷuʔ čəda ɬučədᶻqʼʷəd čəda ɬut'əbš čəda ɬuxʷit'ilagʷil.

English: And Owl had a wife, Frog.

Lushootseed: absčəgʷas tiʔəʔ bədaʔ ʔə tiʔəʔ sbiaw ʔə tə səsaʔliʔ.

Lushootseed: ʔučəɬ čəd x̌ʷubt tulʼʔal tə luƛ' sx̌əlaʔs

Lushootseed: gʷəl tučəɬ ʔalʔal ʔə tiʔəʔ hikʷ.

Lushootseed: ʔuhəliʔdub əlgʷəʔ ʔə tiʔəʔ sučəɬs əlgʷəʔ studəq.

Lushootseed: huyutəbəxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ sč'istxʷs tiʔəʔ čəɬ dᶻuldᶻuləqʼ.

Lushootseed: ƛ'up̕ac̕adəxʷ tiʔəʔ x̌aʔx̌alus buus sučəɬəxʷ sqəlqəlikʷ ʔə tsiʔəʔ čəgʷass.

Lushootseed: ʔudᶻix̌ič ʔal tiʔəʔ sučəɬs hud, suƛ'aƛ'čups.

Lushootseed: gʷəl diɬ haʔɬ tiʔiɬ cədiɬ sč'aʔads dəxʷsčəɬs ti cədiɬ kʼʷastədulic̕aʔ.
English: Their (animal) hair is good for making ceremonial blankets.

Lushootseed: gʷəl tuhuyutəbəxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ čaagʷəsils tiʔəʔ cədiɬ sčəɬs əlgʷəʔ sʔic̕əb sčəɬs əlgʷəʔ sƛ'alalic̕aʔ tulʼʔal tiʔəʔ kʼʷəluʔ ʔə tiʔəʔ tatačulbixʷ.
English: And his now-become-wives prepared this that they made blankets out of, (and) this that they made clothing of, from the hides of the animals .

Lushootseed: dəgʷdəgʷalap kʷədiʔ ƛ'usdaʔ ʔə ti kʷədiʔ səsčəɬs siqiwʼs.

that's what they were doing

Lushootseed: tuhuyəxʷ ʔal tiʔiɬ tushuysəxʷ tiʔiɬ spigʷəds.
English: This is the way it happened when he finished singing.

English: I'll tell her what they did to me, what they did to me and I would have starved from hunger (starved to death).

Do it quickly, you folks.

Lushootseed: yəcəd tiʔəʔ shuyutəbs ʔə tiʔəʔ sqəlalitut
English: He told what the power had done to him.

Lushootseed: tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ t'abid ʔə tiʔəʔ tatačulbixʷ ƛ'ələhuyutəb

Lushootseed: huy diɬəxʷ kʷaʔ dəxʷǰuʔil ʔə tiʔiɬ caadiɬ.

they seem to sparkle

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼ čəd ƛ'ələkawʼawʼɬəb tiʔəʔ tuxʷgʷədgatəd ʔə ti tuʔiišəd čəɬ
English: I'm just trying in a stumbling manner to speak the language of our people.

column3: Did you weave the cedar root basket?

Lushootseed: xʷiʔ. ƛ'uyiqʼid čəd tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ yiqʼʷus, diɬ dəxʷəsdaʔs ʔə kʷi yiqʼʷus. ƛ'ususyiqʼitəbs tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ yiqʼʷus.
English: No. I used a punch tool and pulled cedar root straps around bundles of split roots for this cedar root basket. That's why it is named yiqʼʷus. Because of the way it is punched and coiled, this cedar root basket.
It is different what is called the woven basket.

Lushootseed: gʷəl tulʼ stab kʷi adəxʷuhuyud tiʔəʔ kʷalulč.

Lushootseed: sɬuay tiʔiɬ dəxʷukʷalatəbs tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ skʷalulč.

You weave this woven basket, it is woven.

Let's climb over it.

Lushootseed: kʷatačaac tə sx̌ʷiƛ'əyʔ dxʷʔal tə sbadil
English: Climb the mountain after the mountain goat.

Lushootseed: təlʼtəlawiləxʷ ti bəčlula. tiləxʷ ti skʷatač ʔal ti hikʷ čəbidac. gʷəla kʷatačisəbəxʷ ʔə tiiɬ sčətxʷəd.

Lushootseed: haʔɬ kʷədiʔ sx̌iʔx̌əyʼus ʔə tiʔəʔ cədiɬ

English: I'll win in our bone game because my power is greater than yours.

Lushootseed: ɬuʔiɬqa kʷi dsxʷiʔxʷiʔ kʷə ti ʔiɬqa ti dsyalʼyalt tulʼʔal dəgʷi.

Lushootseed: kʷə ti ʔiɬhaac ti dƛ'əlayʔ tulʼʔal adsgʷaʔ

English: Done. I have finished with bracken roots.
Once I tasted the fern root.

Lushootseed: ləcuč'aʔad əlgʷəʔ tiʔəʔ skʷiʔxʷ, stabəs kʷi sdaʔs ʔal gʷəɬ pastəd.
English: (Two sisters) were digging for fern roots, whatever the white man's name for it is.

Lushootseed: ƛ'utusuʔəɬəd ʔə kʷi tuʔaciɬtalbixʷ tiʔəʔ skʷiʔxʷ. diɬ tusəpləls əlgʷəʔ. ƛ'uč'aʔtəb tiʔəʔ skʷiʔxʷ čəxʷa ƛ'uc̕agʷš čəxʷa ƛ'ušabəd. x̌ʷulʼəxʷ čəxʷ ɬukʼʷasad ɬuadsʔəɬədas tiʔəʔ. diɬ tudᶻixʷ tusʔəɬəd ʔə kʷi dᶻixʷ ʔaciɬtalbixʷ. diɬ tusəpləls. ƛ'ətəsudᶻabitxʷs kʷi sʔuladxʷ.
English: The Indian people used to eat this root. It was their bread. They used to dig this root. And you wash it and you dry it. You just will roast it and you will use it for food. That's the first food of the first people. That was their bread. That's what they ate with their salmon.
We are picking berries.
He was wrapped in a cattail sleeping mat.

Lushootseed: dayʼəxʷ tiʔəʔ kʷuʔt ʔi tiʔəʔ qʼilʼbid tiʔəʔ ʔaʔ.
English: Only the mat and canoe were there.
And one does the cooking.
He cooked himself some food.
Only if you know how you can manage to get it open.
I will let you go momentarily.

Lushootseed: hiwil čəxʷa qʼilid tiʔiɬ səxʷkʼʷadgʷiɬ dxʷʔal ti sdəxʷiɬ.
English: Go and put the bailer in the hunting canoe.
I bent him over backward.

Lushootseed: bələkʼʷaɬatəb tiʔiɬ sbiaw ʔal kʷədiʔ dəxʷʔaʔs.
English: They examined Coyote again there where he was.
Examine it before you take it
I looked myself over (in the mirror to see that my tie was straight, etc., before going out)
I don't want to have to be looking at his face
copulating (?)
I got burned.
He'll get burned.
Don't let him get burned!
How did you get burned?
That is how I got burned.

It's getting barbecued.

Lushootseed: sč'ət'šad tiʔəʔ skʼʷaasəb dsɬiltəb ʔə tiʔəʔ wiwʼsu
English: Roasted fishtail is what the youngsters gave me.

I (intentionally) burned my hand.
I got burned on the arm.
I got burned on the foot.
How did you burn your face?
the hide of a deer

Lushootseed: gʷəl tux̌ʷ tiʔəʔ tələdxʷukʼʷəčacuts x̌ʷulʼ tiʔiɬ dəxʷuč'axʷacuts
English: It was because it became wild that it clubbed itself.

Lushootseed: ʔukʼʷəčtub ʔə ti swawaʔ tsi kʷagʷičəd
English: The cougar tracked the elk.

Maybe (he) will forcast-the-weather.
I'm suspicious of him.
He's suspicious of me.
I'm praying.
birch tree, Betula papyrifera

Isn't that so?

Lushootseed: absčəbid tiʔəʔ čəbidac gʷəl abskʼʷələwʔabac čəɬ.
English: The fir tree has bark and we have skin.
I want to get a haircut.

Lushootseed: huy kʼʷɬaxʷ tiʔiɬ stuligʷəd tulʼʔal tiʔəʔ xʷʔilax̌ad ʔə tiʔiɬ č'ətx̌.
English: Then the blood poured out from Kingfisher's sides.
It was spilled.
It was emptied onto the floor.
again poured for her

Lushootseed: c̕əbəbilb hay gʷəl kʼʷəɬədəxʷ tiʔiɬ sxʷiʔxʷiʔs ʔal kʼʷəɬibəd gʷəl šabadəxʷ ʔal tiʔiɬ hud
English: They picked berries and poured their pickings on this container and dried them at the fire.
poured on me
I poured it on him.
poured on me
only the land that has been landfilled
poured out all my water

It's reported that he's been sent to the war.
They say that's made them swell up.

Lushootseed: ɬixʷixʷ kʼʷəɬ ʔuxʷiʔil ʔal ti dəč'agʷtxʷ
English: They say three people died in that house.
They never missed me.
I missed him (although I intended to meet him.)
He fell on his back.
Lie on your back.
So they lay down, these women.
She read the book.
and I thank (Thee for Thy) pure thoughts
I should isolate myself
What was it that you folks have still isolated yourselves from?
He put himself above me.
Is this how you isolate yourself from us?
(It is) because I am isolating (protecting by avoiding contact with) you and your son.
I isolate you folks from my sore (inflicted) body.

Lushootseed: tələbx̌ qʼil tsiʔəʔ kʼaʔkʼaʔ tiʔəʔ qa tiʔəʔ šidᶻus, kʼʷi bəkʼʷ stab, st'uʔəl, kʷi bəkʼʷ stab
English: Crow had a canoe full of lots of smelt and everything, and herring and everything.

Lushootseed: ʔəyʼdxʷəxʷ qa tiʔəʔ sʔuladxʷ ʔal tiʔiɬ dəč'uʔ stuləkʷ
English: He found a lot of fish in one stream.
There will be a lot of people here.

Lushootseed: təɬaxʷ tiʔiɬ qa ʔaciɬtalbixʷ ʔ uqʼʷuʔəd
English: Truly, they gathered a lot of people.

Lushootseed: hikʷ ʔəsɬaɬlil qa ʔal tiʔacəc swatixʷtəd ʔə tiʔiɬ gʷəɬ dibəɬ ʔal kʷədiʔ tuhaʔkʷ
English: Many dwelt in this place that belonged to us long ago.

Lushootseed: ʔəsʔəx̌id kʷi sqas kʷi ʔaciɬtalbixʷ ʔal dxʷliləp
English: How many Indians are at Tulalip?

Lushootseed: diɬ ʔiɬqa tə dyiqʼus dxʷʔal dəgʷi
English: I have more baskets than you.

Lushootseed: qa tə dyiqʼus x̌ʷulʼab ʔə tə adsgʷaʔ
English: I have as many baskets as you have.
I'm a lot older than you.
They just gathered in a bunch.
Many more flowers are in bloom.

Lushootseed: ʔəsʔəx̌idəxʷ kʷi qahəɬdat kʷi suhuys ʔəsʔistəʔ.
English: For how many days was he doing that?

now many things materialized, came into being (for them)

Lushootseed: ƛ'alʼ čəd bəqahigʷəd x̌ʷulʼab ʔə dəgʷi
English: I'm as clever as you.

You are stingy.

Lushootseed: ƛ'alʼ bəddxʷsqaʔtəd ti bədbədaʔ ʔə ti dqəsiʔ ʔi tsi dʔəpus gʷəl ƛ'alʼ bədsuqʼʷsuqʼʷaʔ tiʔiʔiɬ ʔiɬt'ist'isu bədbədaʔ ʔə ti dqəsiʔ ʔi tsi dʔəpus.
English: Also dxʷs^qaʔtəd are the children of my uncle and my aunt and also are my suqʼʷ^suqʼʷaʔ the younger children of my uncle and my aunt.

(at) the place where he will rest

Lushootseed: qada čəxʷ ʔu ʔə tə sduukʷ
English: Did you steal the knife?

Lushootseed: ʔuqada tiʔəʔ luƛ' ʔə tə sʔuladxʷ
English: The old man stole the salmon.

Lushootseed: diɬ əwʼə tiʔəʔ cədiɬ gəduʔ tiʔəʔ ʔuqadaʔilbəxʷ ʔə ti tusʔəɬəds.

Lushootseed: bəqadadidəxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ səsqʼʷəlb ʔə ti luƛ' ʔə tiʔəʔ sʔuladxʷ tiʔiɬ bəščəb.
English: As was typical, Mink stole the salmon which the old fellow was roasting.

Lushootseed: xʷuʔələʔ ƛ'ub čəd bəqadadid ʔə tiʔiɬ səsqʼʷəlbs čəda gʷəʔəɬəd
English: I guess I should steal from him what he is roasting so I can eat.

Lushootseed: lədxʷsx̌ʷalʼdxʷəb dxʷʔal tiʔəʔ tusqadaditəbs tiʔəʔ tusʔuladxʷs
English: He was wanting to get the best of him because his salmon was stolen by him.
He stole it for him.
Someone stole from the old man.
She sings secretly to herself (slipping one over).
You scolded me.

Lushootseed: tiʔəʔ sqaǰət gʷəl tuʔaləxʷ tiʔəʔ ƛ'ucutəb Whidbey Island miʔmanʼ tiʔəʔ swatixʷtəd ʔə tiʔəʔ sqaǰət. tulʼʔal tiʔəʔ tucutəbəxʷ ʔə Crescent Harbor gʷəl tiʔəʔ Snakelum Point. gʷəl diɬ tiʔəʔ sqaǰət tulʼʔal ʔa tiʔəʔ sqaǰət
English: The Skagit used to be on this place called Whidbey Island. This little land of the Skagit was from what is called Crescent Harbor to Snakelum Point. And this is Skagit, where the Skagit originated.
I speak Skagit.

Lushootseed: ʔəsčal kʷi gʷədsdaʔad ʔal ti qqaǰətəb
English: What do I call it in Skagit?

Lushootseed: gʷəl ʔabilʼəxʷ čəd ɬuhuyud kʷi ləliʔ gʷəl ɬuasqaləkʷ kʷi ɬudshuyud kʷi ɬubəʔiɬlaq.
English: Then, if I make another one, then I'll make the later one round.

that I (should) have acted irresponsibly

Lushootseed: diɬ əwʼə higʷəxʷ ʔudxʷqədidəxʷ tiʔəʔ sʔušəbabdxʷ sbəqʼʷaʔ ʔə tsiʔəʔ čəgʷass, x̌ʷuʔx̌ʷəyʔ.
English: He is the one who really made a cuckold of poor Heron with his wife, Little Diver.

Lushootseed: ʔuqədəb hawʼəʔ ʔə tiʔəʔ cədiɬ sč'ətx̌.
English: She certainly had had sex with Kingfisher.

Lushootseed: hay, qədbaxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ sdukʷ sč'ətx̌.
English: She had had sex with this low-life Kingfisher.

Lushootseed: qədəbtxʷəxʷ tsiʔəʔ čəgʷas ʔə tiʔəʔ sbəqʼʷaʔ, tsiʔəʔ x̌ʷuʔx̌ʷəyʔ.
English: He had sex with Heron's wife, Little Diver.

Lushootseed: qədəbtubəxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ xʷiʔ ləhaʔɬ č'ətx̌ ʔal tə sxʷiʔ ʔə tiʔiɬ cədiɬ.
English: This no good so and so, Kingfisher, has sex with her while that one (Heron) was not (at home).

Lushootseed: ʔuqədbid tiʔəʔ sč'ətx̌ tiʔəʔ dəxʷgʷəlaltəbs ʔə tiʔəʔ sč'istxʷs, ti sbəqʼʷaʔ.
English: Kingfisher had had sex with her so her husband, Heron, beat (punished) her.
His eyes sort of wobbled.
(lest) you folks get your breath blocked off

Lushootseed: diɬ qələb tiʔiɬ adshuyud ti adx̌̌əč
English: That was bad your making up your mind (that way).

Lushootseed: diɬəxʷ qələb tiʔiɬ səshuys ƛ'əsəɬəgʷəlalikʷs ʔə tə qəľəb
English: It is bad the way it is habitually leaving bad (i.e., droppings).
You folks are getting in trouble with grandmother.

Lushootseed: kʷədatəb ʔə tsiʔəʔ tiʔəʔ sqəlad ʔə tiʔəʔ tubədaʔs
English: She (the mother) takes the soiled clothing (diaper) of what was her child

Lushootseed: ʔahəxʷ ʔal tiʔiɬ čaʔkʷ qəlʼqəladiʔ kʷi ɬuadsuwələliʔil

Lushootseed: ʔatəbəd. ʔuʔatəbəd. huy ʔuʔatəbəd. sqəlalitut. hikʷ ʔəsqəlalitut. tux̌ʷ bəuʔatəbəd
English: He died, he died. Yet he died. (He had) power. (He had) great power and yet he died.

Lushootseed: sqəlalitut tiʔəʔ dəxʷtəšs ʔaʔ dəxʷəsx̌əɬ ʔə tiʔəʔ sqəlalitut
English: It is the spirit power that has afflicted and caused him to be sick
earth power

Lushootseed: lədaʔacut, lədaʔacut tiʔəʔ sqəlalitut. gʷəl gʷədəxʷəshaydubs ʔə tiʔəʔ ʔuləqəd. tulʼʔal qʼixʷ tiʔəʔ sqəlalitut.
English: They identify themselves, these powers identify themselves. So that the one who is listening will know it. This power is from up-river.
sacred spirit power which can help someone who is ill

Lushootseed: ʔəsqəqalil tiʔiɬ stubš ʔal ti x̌əɬalʔtxʷ

It's starting to rain.

Lushootseed: ʔabilʼəxʷ čəd gʷəʔibəš, ɬualc̕uqəlbas čəda gʷəƛ'ax̌

Lushootseed: ʔəsqpali tsi dsqa, ckʼʷaqid sx̌aƛ's kʷi gʷəsuʔibəšs ɬuʔuqəlbas
English: My older sister is crazy. She likes to walk when it's raining.

(The river) is turbid.

Lushootseed: ɬubəbəlkʷaxʷ əlgʷəʔ dxʷʔal tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ č'it ɬqʼucid ʔə tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ sʔilucid ʔə dxʷqəlb.
English: And they would again return to this near-place across from the mouth of "Muddy River".

Lushootseed: qəlbut tiʔiɬ sʔušəbabdxʷ tux̌ʷ čəxʷ ʔəshigʷəd
English: Even though poor you (should) uphold them.

Lushootseed: ʔəsʔəx̌id əwʼəʔ tiʔiɬ ƛ'udsəsqəldub ʔə tiʔiɬ cəxʷʔacəc sɬəɬadəyʔ dxʷʔal kʷi gʷədsʔux̌ʷ dxʷʔistəʔulgʷədxʷ gʷəšayiləd
English: Why is it that I am forbidden by the woman where I am not to go hunting in that direction.

old and infirm
with a little blanket pinned around her

Lushootseed: bəciqʷ tiʔiʔəʔ gʷəl qəlʼqəlil kʷədiʔ sxʷiʔxʷiʔs.

Lushootseed: qəɬcut, qəɬcut! tiləb čəxʷ ʔugʷədil. ɬuwʷiʔəxʷ bələʔitut

Lushootseed: cutcuttəb ʔə tiʔiɬ ʔaciɬtalbixʷ x̌əɬ ti gʷəqɬad.

Lushootseed: tusaqʼʷtxʷ dxʷšəq gʷəl xʷit'ild dxʷʔal tiʔiɬ č'ƛ'aʔ gʷəl tudᶻuqʼʷil ti č'awəyʔ ʔə ti sʔax̌ʷuʔs huy qiyədxʷ gʷəl huydxʷ

Lushootseed: ʔəbilʼəxʷ gʷəl qʼagʷalx̌ʷ, tux̌ʷ kʼʷəɬ x̌ʷəc tiʔiɬ qʼagʷalx̌ʷ.

Lushootseed: kʷədadəxʷ əlgʷəʔ tiʔəʔ ʔəsšab biac gʷəl ɬudəgʷadəxʷ əlgʷəʔ ʔal ləsak gʷəl ɬuqʼəc̕ucid əlgʷəʔ.

Lushootseed: bələsqʼiltubəxʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ cədiɬ qʼilʼbids əlgʷəʔ

Lushootseed: tuʔux̌ʷtubəxʷ ʔə kʷi tusʔux̌ʷtubs tsiʔəʔ cədiɬ tuasqʼiƛ'qʼiƛ'.

getting short (time is running out)
short person, short of stature

they doubted me

sweetness of the bee (i.e., honey)

Lushootseed: ʔəxʷqʷalusəb ʔə tiʔəʔ qah təbɬ, pəɬt təbɬ.

Lushootseed: diʔɬəxʷ kʷi supipəkʷpəkʷ ʔə cədiɬ təsəxʷqʷaluss, səxʷliqʼʷuss.

English: ... and grass (or hay) grows (there) so they named the Nisqually for the grassy land.

Lushootseed: huy qʷaɬadəxʷ sixʷ tiʔəʔ wiwʼsu ɬulilcutəs.

Lushootseed: haʔɬ kʷi ƛ'uadsəsšuucbicut ʔal kʷi ƛ'uadsəqʷɬalps

lie
place, to lay something down

Lushootseed: ƛ'uhuyalcbid tiʔəʔ qʼilʼbid gʷəl ƛ'uƛ'alyibəxʷ tiʔəʔ sx̌əyʼuss
English: The canoe would be made and (then) its head would be added.

Lushootseed: diič'uʔ tsiʔəʔ x̌əɬ ti tiləb ƛ'ux̌iid.
English: One of the women sort of caught on (was wise to the happenings).

Lushootseed: hikʷ čəd ʔuhuytub ʔal tiʔiɬ dəsx̌idub
English: They really gave it to me when they caught me at it.
The people would catch (me) doing it.

Lushootseed: tiləb ʔa tiʔiɬ sbəčs gʷəl x̌iʔalbut.
English: It was there that he landed when he became conscious.
The cat clawed (grabbed, scratched) me.
You grabbed me.
We grabbed you folks.

Lushootseed: ƛ'ux̌ibid tiʔiɬ kʼʷəčiidiʔ ʔi tiʔiɬ kʼʷat'ad. tiʔəʔ dəxʷəsʔəƛ' ʔə tiʔəʔ sdaʔ ʔə tiʔəʔ x̌ibx̌ib.
English: It grabs rabbits and mice. This is where hawk's name comes from.
The cat clawed me.
I just grabbed my things (not having time to pack carefully).
You clawed my back.
It clawed me all up.

Lushootseed: ɬux̌ic čələp dᶻixʷbid ʔə kʷi ɬuadsʔibəš.
English: You will lunch before you travel.
He just lunches.
This girl was angry.

Lushootseed: ʔəsx̌ic̕il čəd dxʷʔal ti dsubədčəbid tiʔiɬ
English: I'm guilty of having told him a lie.
It was really ugly.
I'm mean.
(We) got lonesome today.
Soft, strange stillness in the land as though the world were lonesome.
Tom is lonesome.
I'm really lonesome for you.

Lushootseed: ƛ'uʔux̌ʷ čəd dxʷʔal tiʔəʔ səxʷx̌iliqəd ʔə tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ stuləkʷ
English: I go where (the river) has washed away some of its bank (landslide).
to where cedar trees have their roots washed clear of the river bank.

Lushootseed: haʔɬ sʔəɬəd tiʔəʔ ʔudᶻəgʷaʔil əwʼə ƛ'əsiɬux̌ilix̌.
English: It was good food that they were expertly battling.

Lushootseed: ƛ'ux̌ilix̌əɬi tux̌ʷ xʷiʔ kʷi stab dəxʷhaʔɬ čəɬ.
English: When we would fight, there was nothing where we were good. (I.e., they could not protect themselves.)
... with whom they used to battle for a long time

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼ ƛ'uux̌ilix̌tub tiʔəʔ qʷiqʷqʷistayʼbixʷ ʔə tiʔəʔ buʔqʷ.
English: These ducks simply warred on the Dwarfs.
might be said to be chopped to shape
(A beaver) fells the trees(s).
(A beaver) fells trees.
The cat scratched me.
The bears are scratching themselves.
Scratch my head.
He's scratching his head.
She scratched my back.

Lushootseed: ʔalc̕ux̌iqʼx̌iqʼitəb ʔə tsə pišpiš tə xʷt'agʷtap
English: The cat is scratching the chair.
I'm squatting.
ashamed (of ourselves)
For a shame!

Lushootseed: ʔəsx̌ix̌iʔ čəd dxʷʔal ti dsubədčəbid tiʔiɬ
English: I'm ashamed that I lied to him.
They were ashamed of Coyote.
I was kind of bashful then.
I won't (do something).
what they are competing for
simply insisted
racing
Don't argue (don't answer back).
race horse
I fell out of the shovel-nose canoe.
Several families were slaughtered
Then (their parents) just beat the children.
what someone can't comprehend, can't master
I'm too weak to carry it; it's too heavy for me
I was defeated; I lost a game; I couldn't catch any fish
get the better of me

Lushootseed: xʷiʔ gʷəsx̌ʷalʼ ʔə tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ luƛ'
English: the old (fellow) did not give up
He was wanting to get the best of him.

Lushootseed: ʔəshaydub ʔə tiʔəʔ ʔux̌ʷalʼdxʷ tiʔəʔ č'əƛ'aʔaʔkʷbixʷ sgʷədilič.
English: It (the power) knows the one who has overpowered the rock species of power.
I can't control it.

Lushootseed: I can't quite use it (due to my lack of ability, knowledge, etc.)

English: I lost it; it's too heavy for me to lift.

Lushootseed: ʔəsx̌ʷalʼbid cəɬ ʔə tə sʔux̌ʷ dxʷʔal tə sqʼax̌ʷ
English: We can't control it when it goes on the ice.
They didn't catch the thief.
I give up (because my body is fatigued).
They gave up.
They didn't catch the thief.
The bear didn't get the man.
They failed to get control over (i.e., catch) Kingfisher.
I give up (because it is too much for me to figure out or my patience has given out)

I give up.
I can't manage my legs (from knees down). (An expression meaning that one is very tired from walking.)
He's got a band around his head
I'm going to put a band around my head
He wrapped a (ceremonial) band around his head
have (something worn) wrapped at the waist
wrapped (ceremonial) bands around his legs
worry
I'm busy.
Something is bothering that man.
Don't pay any attention to that bear.
She worked herself up, was troubled.
I'm too busy, I'm troubled.
I'm bothered by my son.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷax̌ʷəqʼʷbidəxʷ tsiʔəʔ ʔalš dxʷʔal kʷi gʷədəxʷhəliʔis
English: He is worried about how to make his sister well.
I'm a bother to my mother
Her brother, Raven, worried about her.

Lushootseed: ʔux̌ʷaqʼʷigʷəd čəd dxʷʔal ti spapstəd čəɬ
English: I'm worried about our young white boy.
I'm worried.
He is annoyed by the children.
Raven is worrying now.
Something is bothering that man.
His coffee isn't very strong.
His coffee is real strong.
His coffee isn't very strong.
because of the strong odor

Lushootseed: x̌ʷəlilc ʔi kʷi x̌ʷəlbit ʔi kʷi ʔiɬčəx̌bit tiʔiɬ x̌əčalc ʔə tiʔiɬ puʔtəd
English: The shirt is 9.95 dollars

Lushootseed: x̌ʷiʔəxʷ kʷi ƛ'uadsux̌ʷəlqʷcut ʔal kʷi ɬuadsuʔišɬ
English: You will not make noise with your paddle.
The dog is getting fat.
I fattened up the bull.

Lushootseed: ʔux̌ʷsild čəd tə sč'istxʷ ʔə tə haʔɬ dsqʼʷəldaliɬəd
English: I fattened up (my) husband with my good cooking.
It is scattered.
It's torn
I tore my shirt

Lushootseed: ʔəsʔəx̌id kʷi sləliʔ ʔə tə x̌ʷətis dxʷʔal swuqʷa
English: What is the difference between a regular (or silver) diver and a loon?

Lushootseed: tiʔəʔ swuqʷa gʷəl diɬ hikʷbid dxʷʔal tiʔəʔ x̌ʷətis. ʔiɬhikʷ
English: A loon is bigger than a regular diver. It is bigger.

Lushootseed: gʷəl x̌ʷuʔx̌ʷəyʔ gʷəl həlaʔb biʔbad. tiʔəʔ x̌ʷətis gʷəl hikʷbid dxʷʔal tsiʔəʔ x̌ʷuʔx̌ʷəyʔ
English: But the little diver is real small. The regular diver is bigger than the little diver.

white
dark blue, dark green

I scratched my face.
all scratched up
I'm lost.
I got lost right here.
I'm lost in this town.
I got lost way up mountainward.
It's lost, that which I use to write with.
lost my money
I got lost easily.
Are you lost?
How much do I owe you?
I'll pay you what I owe you.
(He) simply lost his wife.

Lushootseed: bəkʼʷ čəd ʔəsx̌ʷix̌ʷild, yaʔɬəxʷ čəd ƛ'uʔugʷəč'əd
English: I have everything misplaced, vainly I search for them.
I lost that which I use to write with.

Lushootseed: hi siʔab, x̌ʷiʔ ləx̌ʷilʼdxʷ ti adtalə
English: Hey buddy, don't lose your money!
I lost it.

three "spans"

Lushootseed: ɬux̌ʷisid əlgʷəʔ bəkʼʷ čad ʔal tiʔiɬ x̌aƛ' čad, ʔəsɬəqʷdup dəxʷʔals tiʔiɬ ʔulʔal saʔdup.
English: They will make-a-volume of noise everywhere: in the thickets, in the wetplace(s) where the bullrush (cattail) bad place is.

Lushootseed: sʔušəbabdxʷəxʷ tiʔiɬ adɬaləp̕ təč ti adsux̌ʷudx̌ʷud
English: Your poor tongue tangles (?) when you talk.

Lushootseed: xʷiʔ kʷi gʷat ʔuɬəčil gʷəl ʔux̌ʷududx̌ʷud kʷi syəcəb gʷəl ʔəcə
English: No one comes (to) converse (exchange) news (with) me.
You will be near your son.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼəb ʔə tə buʔqʷ tiʔiɬ qyuuqs
English: A seagull is just like a waterfowl.

Lushootseed: haʔɬ kʷi gʷəsčalatəbs tiadsgʷaʔ addšəɬx̌əčəb ʔal ti swatixʷtəd x̌ʷulʼab ʔə təsuč'alad ti adsgʷaʔ adsšəɬx̌əčəb ʔal di šəq
English: Thy kingdom come, in earth as it is in heaven.

Lushootseed: ƛ'ub čəxʷ ʔubaliicyitubuɬ ʔə tə dᶻəkʼʷadəd čəɬ x̌ʷulʼab ʔə təsubaliicyid čəɬ tə ləliʔ ʔaciɬtalbixʷ ʔə tə dᶻəkʼʷadəds dxʷʔal dibəɬ
English: And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼab ʔə ti bads ti shadᶻəbs tiʔiɬ ľəgʷəb
English: That youth is as tall as his father.

Lushootseed: x̌əɬəxʷ əlgʷəʔ ti ƛ'ux̌ʷulʼabil əlgʷəʔ ƛ'utadᶻ.
English: They sort of become like (people) who dance.

Lushootseed: x̌ʷulʼulʼ bəc̕ac tiʔəʔ diʔəʔ basket ʔəshuytub ʔə tsiʔəʔ diʔəʔ sƛ'alqəb
English: Basket Woman had made the basket all out of snakes.
nothing other than a ceremonial blanket

English: Nothing but backbones, nothing but heads (were there at) your former fireplaces (houses).

Lushootseed: x̌ʷuqʼʷud dxʷʔal ti pədixʷ tiʔiɬ x̌əkʼʷəd.

friend
close relation

Lushootseed: x̌alad ti adsdaʔ ʔal ti sgʷədyalus
English: Write your name on the bottom edge.
top of the page

Lushootseed: x̌ʷədᶻx̌ʷədᶻyalus tiʔəʔ sdəxʷiɬ gʷəl ʔəsp̕ilp̕ilyalus tiʔəʔ ƛ'əlayʔ
English: A hunting canoe has sharp (pointed) ends, but a shovel-nose canoe has flat ends.

Lushootseed: diɬəxʷ ɬusgʷaʔs ɬusəsyayus ʔə tiʔəʔ təkʷtəkʷəlus.

Lushootseed: gʷəl tux̌ʷ haʔkʷ kʷi ɬudsyayusbid tiʔiɬ dsuyayus.

Lushootseed: cugʷəxʷ ʔu sɬadəyʔ kʷi ʔuyayus ʔə kʷi haʔɬ kʷi dəxʷʔux̌ʷcs.

English: He told what the power had done to him.

Lushootseed: yəcəbəxʷ ʔə tiʔiɬ bibščəb ʔi tiʔiɬ suʔsuqʼʷaʔs tətyiqa ʔə tiʔiɬ sɬaliltubsəxʷ
English: (He) reported the news about Little Mink and his little younger brother tətyiqa, about their being brought ashore.
